definition: a revolutionary
animal hide/leather/to reform/to remove/to expel (from office)
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Thus, this ------ embarked on the path of a professional revolutionary.
sentences.chinese: 一個弱冠少年，由此走上職業革命家的道路。

sentences.english: He has a mind to become a revolutionary.
So had most of the veteran revolutionaries.
sentences.chinese: 同樣西去的還有大多數老一輩革命家。
馬奇亞維利是位革命家。

sentences.english: The community of proletariat revolutionaries from Hunan develops from Hunan Xinmin Society.
sentences.chinese: 湘籍無產階級革命家羣體的起點是新民學會。

sentences.english: The trophy is named after Giuseppe Garibaldi, an Italian revolutionary born in Nizza (now Nice) in 1807.
sentences.chinese: 加里波第是一名意大利革命家。

sentences.english: For Mark was before all else a revolutionist.
sentences.chinese: 因爲馬克思首先是一個革命家。

sentences.english: This year is birthday of Peng Zhen of revolutionist of older generation proletariat 100 years.
sentences.chinese: 今年是老一輩無產階級革命家彭真誕辰100週年。

sentences.english: Perhaps he simply couldn’t make the final jump from revolutionary to statesman.
sentences.chinese: 可能他只是不能完成從革命家到政治家的最後飛躍。

sentences.english: Lin Boqu, Chinese soldier and revolutionary, died of illness in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 中國軍事家和革命家林柏渠在北京病逝。

sentences.english: Zhang Wentian was an outstanding proletarian revolutionist and theorist.
sentences.chinese: 張聞天是一位傑出的無產階級革命家和理論家。

sentences.english: For Marx was before all else a revolutionist.
sentences.chinese: 對馬克思而言，他最重要的身份是革命家。

sentences.english: Zhang Wen day is a great proletarian revolutionist not only.
sentences.chinese: 張聞天不僅是一個偉大的無產階級革命家。
革命家們，我向你們敬禮。

definition: democrats
democratic revolution/bourgeois revolution (in Marx-Leninist theory, a prelude to the proletarian revolution)
military expert/general
thinker
statesman/politician/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4],名[ming2]
great person
Chen Duxiu (1879-1942), co-founder of the Chinese Communist Party in 1921
Li Dazhao (1889-1927), early Chinese Marxist and founding member of the communist party
industrialist
Chen Tianhua (1875-1905), anti-Qing revolutionary from Hunan, drowned himself in Japan in 1905

Qu Qiubai (1899-1935), politician, Soviet expert of the Chinese communists at time of Soviet influence, publisher and Russian translator, captured and executed by Guomindang at the time of the Long March
diplomat
father or founder of a nation/Father of the Republic (Sun Yat-sen)
Wu Yuzhang (1878-1966), writer, educator and communist politician
Bolshevik
democracy
